text: I think if you're showing it off for the FX, then a curved wall is fine, as that's what they're looking at. If you want to show how you can light it, render it, comp it, then pop it in a shot. Yes popping it in a shot just for the FX makes it look better, but weigh up the time it takes to track/light/comp it compared to that time spent improving the FX

The one you've got above, on the background, is fine. I'd maybe try to give it some good shaders if you can,  show that it works with textures, but that would work in a showreel piece I think (that's my opinion anyway)
